Job Title: Associate Benefits Data Analyst / Benefits Data Analyst I - Remote
Job Description:
When it comes to making a meaningful difference in the lives of our customers and employees, USAble Life (a Life & Specialty Ventures Company) is always ready.
At USAble Life, we strive to have a positive impact in the lives of others, especially our employees. We are a diverse group of individuals working together to go the extra mile. Bring your talents and expertise to join our team, and you’ll be rewarded with opportunities for personal and professional development. Our passion for delivering the best products is matched by our passion for our people.
USAble Life has made Arkansas Business Magazine’s list of “Best Places to Work” for an impressive fifth consecutive year in a row! This, coupled with our engaging culture and a comprehensive benefits package, ensures we are committed to our employees.
Life Takes You Places! Are you ready to join us?
What We Offer You:
A culture that values employees and celebrates, empowers, and inspires a diverse workforce
Outstanding and affordable benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, and company HSA contribution in 31 days or less
401(k) with up to a 6% match that is fully vested from day one
PTO provided on date of start plus 11 paid holidays
Yearly performance bonus and merit increases
Tuition Reimbursement
Wellness Program
This is a remote position ideally in CST zone.
An Associate Benefits Data Analyst will:
Play a vital role in the success of existing group's annual re-enrollment and the on-going management of new hire eligibility and elections.
Work with business partners during their annual re-enrollment period.
Be responsible for verifying all offered benefits and eligibility rules, managing milestones, duplicating the existing application set-ups or making minor modifications as necessary.
Test the enrollment solution to ensure that the employer's administrative practices are properly reflected in the enrollment solution as well as in the post-enrollment information exchanged with carriers and internal partners.
Monitor the live enrollment process, and delivers eligibility and deduction files in a timely manner.
This is a multi level position.
Essential Duties:
Work closely with sales, account managers, partner agencies or senior members of the team to schedule the group's re-enrollment, verify changes to benefits and/or administrative rules and obtain the most recent group census.
Duplicate the group's enrollment application and modifies the configuration based on changes requested by the group.
Ensure the credibility of the enrollment solution as well a positive experience for groups and their employees
Determine key deliverables.
Develops, maintains or modifies documentation to reflect the group's benefits and administrative rules for new groups or re-enrollments. Effectively communicates milestones, assesses and mitigates project risk, and works closely with all partners to ensure customer acceptance and satisfaction.
Develop, duplicate or modify test scenarios which reflect each instance of the group's benefits offering.
Test enrollment platform based on developed scenarios; document results and work with senior members of the team to resolve complex configuration related problems.
Release application for enroller testing and modifies based on feedback.
Validate and deliver election and/or deduction files to the appropriate internal or external partners.
Track processing of files to ensure employee access to insurance services and payroll deductions are accurately updated and billing correctly reflects changes to participation and premium as a result of a successful enrollment.
Analyze the group's most recent census information to ensure that benefits match the defined rules.
Work with senior members of the team when working with complex data comparisons or data consolidation from multiple sources.
Work with Team Lead to identify improvements to the platform and improve the overall enrollment experience.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledgeable about benefits administration including eligibility rules, annual and new hire enrollment cycles
Good data analytical skills: able to understand, develop and test the relationships between configured rules, eligibility scenarios, data sources, and data output
Effective troubleshooting ability: able to recognize discrepancies by working backward from expected outcomes and data output to configuration settings and benefits requirements
Able to resolve simple configuration issues
Strong work management skills: knows how to manage multiple enrollment requests simultaneously, tracking and communicating milestones and risks
Effective written and oral communication skills demonstrating knowledge of benefits administration process when working with enrollers, account managers, groups, vendors or distribution partners
Intermediate knowledge Microsoft Office suite especially Excel and business writing tools like Word and Outlook
Basic knowledge of PowerPoint, Visio or comparative applications
Required Education and Experience:
Associates Degree in Information Systems, Accounting, or Business Analysis. May substitute certifications in relevant fields and/or equivalent work experience for education.
1 year experience in Insurance Administration or Employee Benefits Administration.
Or, equivalent military experience
Preferred Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration with focus in Information Systems, Finance, Accounting or certification(s) in a related field(s).
1 or more years' experience with annual enrollment projects or enrollment applications.
A Benefits Data Analyst I will:
Work with new and existing groups who have smaller employee populations and whose benefits offering, administrative rules, enrollment needs and data structures are of a low to moderate complexity.
Work with business partners and employer groups during their annual re-enrollment period.
Gather all offered benefits and administration rules, and configure a new enrollment platform for groups new to Enrollment Services.
Duplicate and/or modify an existing platform.
Articulate pre-formatted, excel based data exchange layouts, reviews and validates census data against the administrative rules and tests all enrollment scenarios.
Monitor the live enrollment and delivers eligibility and deduction files accurately and on time.
Essential Duties:
Work closely with sales, account managers, partner agencies or senior members of the team to schedule the group's re-enrollment, verify changes to benefits and/or administrative rules and obtain the most recent group census.
When implementing groups new to USAble Life's Benefits Data solutions, work closely with sales, account managers, partner agencies, group administrators or vendors to understand the groups benefits, eligibility rules, administrative practices and data exchange requirements.
For re-enrollments, duplicate the group's enrollment application and modify the configuration based on changes requested by the group.
For groups new to USAble Life's Enrollment Solutions: configure a new application which reflects offered benefits, administrative rules, enrollment approach and eligibility data.
Ensure a positive experience as well as credibility in the enrollment solution.
Determine key deliverables.
Develop, maintain or modify documentation to reflect the group's benefits and administrative rules for re-enrollments.
Effectively communicate milestones, assess and mitigate project risk, and work closely with all partners to ensure customer acceptance and satisfaction.
Develop, duplicate or modify test scenarios which reflect each instance of the group's benefits offering.
Test enrollment platform based on developed scenarios; document results and work with senior members of the team to resolve complex configuration related problems.
Release application for enroller testing and modifies based on feedback.
Validate and deliver election and/or deduction files to the appropriate internal or external partners.
Track processing of files to ensure employee access to insurance services and payroll deductions are accurately updated and billing correctly reflects changes to participation and premium as a result of a successful enrollment.
Analyze the group's census information to ensure that benefits' classes & benefits match the defined rules.
Work with senior members of the team when working with complex data comparisons or data consolidation from multiple sources.
Work with Team Lead to identify improvements to the platform and improve the overall enrollment experience.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Strong knowledge of benefits administration including eligibility rules, annual and new hire enrollment cycles
Strong understanding of the enrollment capabilities of one of the offered platforms
Able to understand and configure an enrollment platform based on moderately complex eligibility requirements, administrative rules, source data and data output
Good data analytical skills: able to understand, develop and test the relationships between configured rules, eligibility scenarios, data sources, and data output
Strong troubleshooting ability: able to trace causes of discrepancies by working backward from expected outcomes and data output to configuration settings and benefits requirements
Use understanding of platform capability to independently resolve configuration issues
Strong work management skills: knows how to manage multiple enrollment requests simultaneously, tracking and communicating milestones and risks
Effective written and oral communication skills demonstrating knowledge of benefits administration process when working with enrollers, account managers, groups, vendors or distribution partners
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office suite especially Excel and business writing tools like Word and Outlook
Basic knowledge of PowerPoint, Visio or comparative applications
Required Education and Experience:
Associates Degree in Information Systems, Accounting, or Business Analysis. May substitute certifications in relevant fields and/or equivalent work experience for education.
2 years' experience in Insurance Administration or Employee Benefits Administration.
Or, equivalent military experience
Preferred Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration with focus in Information Systems, Finance, Accounting or certification(s) in a related field(s).
2 or more years' experience with annual enrollment projects or implementing enrollment applications.

Introduction to the job
ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Ariz., San Jose and San Diego, Calif., Wilton, Conn., and Hillsboro, Ore.
As a business analyst at ASML it is your role to collect, analyze and translate our data into business insights. You will support the generation of business insights by using a combination of cross-sector data sources and applying leading analytics tools and technologies on these sources in order to enable optimization of ASML and customer value.
This position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require the Company to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.
Role and responsibilities
For the Integrated Business Planning team, your role will be to provide support to the Demand Planning and Financial Planning & Analysis teams. You will work to provide input on forecast updates as well as supporting ad-hoc projects impacting operating costs. Responsibilities include the following:
Generate business insights by translating data into visuals, reports, and dashboards
Support in formulating problem statements and performing exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns
Apply leading analytics tools and technologies to develop in-depth understanding of structured and unstructured data on the topic at hand
Interact with technical and non-technical (cross-sector) stakeholders and be able to present and explain analytical problems, approach, results, and recommendations
Interpret statistical model outputs and translate into forecasts for factory and financial planning
Support business with reporting, analysis, and improvement proposals
Develop and maintain strong stakeholder management relationships
Develop and maintain strong stakeholder management relationships
Perform other duties as assigned
Job description subject to change at any time
Education and experience
We are looking for candidates with high potential to grow the role, challenge themselves, and contribute to ASML’s success. This role can be augmented for candidates with higher levels of applicable education and experience, however, these are not a requirement.
Relevant bachelor / master degree (technical or business administration) with 2 years of professional experience
Relevant work experience which utilized analysis of data to make informed decision
Experience with financial or other data analysis and analytic tools (tool examples: Excel, Spotfire, Tableau)
Experience in or the knowledge of the semiconductor industry is a plus
Strong English communication skills (written & oral)
Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:
Strong capability for problem solving, customer focus, task prioritization, high quality of work, and adaptability
Must be able to read and interpret data, information and documents.
Ability to learn and apply new information or skills
Aptitude for optimizing processes and identifying / implementing improvement opportunities
Ability to work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision
Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication
Be result driven - demonstrate ownership and accountability
Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads
Proficient use of all Microsoft Office suite programs
Experience with data visualization tools, Oracle, Business Objects, or SQL is a plus
Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.
Other information

Routinely required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch. Occasionally required to move around the campus.
Occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.

Travel not required, however, some travel opportunities may be available

Work according to a strict set of procedures within the provided timelines

ASHLIN Management Group is seeking a Data Analyst to join our team working with our data analytics team. This professional will start off working with ASHLIN’s cloud-based visualization platform, CompassBI, powered by Sisense, on visualizing descriptive statistics and other key performance indicators and building ASHLIN’s library of dashboard templates. Additional projects will include supporting our team of project specialist in developing deliverables to our clients, based research and analysis methods, using statistical models on business data collected in field. Candidates should also be comfortable preparing routine as well as ad-hoc business reports and PowerPoint decks to present the information to senior management and clients.
Essential duties and responsibilities:
· Develop visualizations using tools such as Tableau, PowerBI and/or Sisense
· Use sophisticated data analysis methods to support project team in creating deliverable for client
· Work with clients to devise methods to optimize data capturing schemes and overall program evaluation plan Perform statistical modeling (e.g. ANOVA) using statistical software applications such as R and SPSS
· Work with Senior Database Architect(s) to develop analytical SQL queries and reports for tracking, trending, and interpreting business data
· Perform ongoing data quality assessments, identify discrepancies/inconsistencies, and resolve them
· Continually improve the end-to-end process of data collection, transformation, analysis, and reporting
· Develop data management programs and forms for data entry and maintenance by end-users
· Document data analysis and reporting architecture, designs, and write user guides
· Other duties as defined by senior research team
Qualifications
To be successful in this position, the Data Analyst must have a minimum of 3 years’ experience in:
§ Data analysis, involved in both primary and secondary research using data to arrive at decision pertaining to marketing strategies
§ Ability to interpret complex data sets (quantitative and qualitative) into insights that lead to effective marketing strategies and frameworks
§ Strong data analysis modelling, specifically the successful candidate must be able to:
§ Conduct cross-tabular and ANOVA and other statistical analysis using R and/or SPSS
§ Interpret results of statistical analysis output and draw insights in order to make recommendations to senior management what steps to take
§ Present data, interpretation and resulting strategy in language that indicates a command of the material while at the same time making sense to lay persons who may not have a marketing and/or data analysis background
§ Develop data reports using the following tools and technologies:
§ MS-Excel (Pivot Tables, VBA, Power Pivot, H-Lookup, V-Lookup, Import/Export from/to external data sources)
§ Online Dashboards (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Sisense)
§ Expert level skills in the development of highly impactful PowerPoint slide decks
§ Development of scheduled and ad-hoc reports and analysis.
§ Working in a team environment with responsibility for delivery of timely and accurate business-critical reports and analysis:
§ Self-motivated and proactive, willing to drive a program of work to successful completion,
§ Strong oral/written communication, and presentation skills,
§ Ability to work with highly sensitive information and preserve the confidentiality of the information,
§ Detail oriented and capable of identifying and resolving data quality issues.
In addition, the following are highly desirable:
§ A minimum of 3 years’ experience with statistical analysis tools (e.g. R, SPSS)
§ A background in market research, or related disciplines
§ Working knowledge of relational databases (e.g. SQL)
Position requirements include:

Data/EDI Analyst is responsible for all aspects of EDI quality and analysis. The Analyst will be accountable for the quality, receipt, intake and analysis of EDI data from external sources. They will partner with external data providers to ensure the quality of incoming data, as well as resolve data issues while strategically trying to drive continuous improvement efforts to eliminate root causes. This position also works closely with internal business units and provides accurate data to allow for making the best business decisions possible. Must identify and drive continuous improvements in the quality and availability of EDI data.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Protect the information assets of the company, including intellectual property, personally identifiable information, and protected health information, against unauthorized alteration and/or disclosure by appropriately handling and transmitting information in accordance with company policies.
Accountable for receiving and importing accurate data from external parties.
Ensure integrity of data in database and warehouse for reporting and analytical purposes.
Analyze and validate data completeness, consistency, accuracy, and compliance to data standards and principles.
Investigate and identify EDI data quality issues. Addresses the root cause of data problems and develop a recommendation on how to resolve issues. Collaborate with data source stakeholders to implement resolution.
Work collaboratively with TPAs, business users, and vendors to improve service levels on existing and new data feeds.
Communicates directly with TPAs and other third parties for accurate and timely receipt of data.
Perform analysis of data sources with an emphasis on identifying critical data elements and developing data metrics and quality checks.
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Perform data quality audits around inconsistent, incorrect and incomplete data on a monthly basis. Communicate audit findings to data providers for resolution.
Quickly and accurately troubleshoot data import issues and communicate or implement solutions.
Investigate, evaluate, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of current data requirements and processes and develop strategies for improving these processes.
Implement data quality monitoring reports, alerts, and processes.
Benchmark and improve data quality from all data sources.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree required.
At least 2 years of experience working in either I.S. or finance department.
Ability to query relational databases using standard SQL.
Capacity to extract, analyze, and reconcile large sums of data.
Success in handling abundant, varied workload with ability to switch quickly between projects and tasks.
Hands-on approach to data quality while supporting data quality initiatives.
Strong analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to exercise independent judgment.
Self-starter who can work with minimal direct supervision, and take ownership of projects.
Ability to work effectively with a diverse group of business and technical personnel.

Description
At Constellation, a freshly independent and soon-to-be Fortune 200 company, we're providing the energy and services to transform our future. Combining next generation technologies and product offerings with the country's lowest carbon generating fleet, our company is purpose-built to meet the challenges of the climate crisis.

Constellation has been the leader in clean energy production for more than a decade. Now we're speeding delivery of low-carbon or no-carbon power to help families, communities, governments, and businesses meet their sustainability and decarbonization goals. Constellation provides 10 percent of total clean power and 22 percent of clean baseload power in the United States and is the leading competitive retail supplier of energy products, services and clean energy solutions. The race is on to confront climate change, and no company is more ready to meet that challenge.

We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners and communities. We provide a workplace that ensures mutual respect, where each individual has the opportunity to grow and contribute at their greatest potential. Constellation will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and power a successful career.

Join us as we accelerate the transition to a carbon-free future. Energize your career with Constellation.

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION
This full-time, key position reports directly to the Manager, Partner Contact Management and is responsible for researching and compiling data on competitive pricing offers, compile and distribute KPI Scorecards and analyze customer feedback. In addition, this position is responsible for making recommendations and improvement based on data and report analysis.

Service Ticket Management: Monitor service tickets created and assigned to Care, follow up with responsible parties and provide daily status report -30%
Continuous Improvement: Make recommendations for improvements based on data and report analysis. -5%
Reports and Presentations: Prepare Leadership level reports and presentations on customer trends, impacts and other ad hoc needs -5%

Minimum:
Bachelor’s degree preferred, although candidates with 3-5 or more years in equivalent business experience will be considered
Advanced skills with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access)
Ability to communicate effectively and professionally with internal and external parties at all levels within the organization
Obtain and analyze data without supervision and can reason through complex scenarios to recommend course of action or remediation
Effectively communicate with, develop and maintain strong cross functional relationships

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Management, Management Information Technology or Supply Chain Management
Prior experience in the retail energy industry and/or regulated energy industry
Prior experience in using CRM
Working knowledge of UDC/ISO market EDI transactions
Advanced skills in Microsoft Access and/or SQL database query development
Previous vendor management experience a plus
POSITION SCOPE
Level of independence, decision-making authority or strategic planning accountability: Medium - Analyzes data and workflow situations without supervision and determines course of action or remediation for complex service scenarios
Internal and external contact relationships: Key external contacts include Constellation Vendors. Key internal contacts include the Leadership Team, Retail Sales, Federal and State Regulatory and Policy Groups, Customer Care, Contract Administration, Billing, Pricing, Forecasting and Legal.

Job Description
Disney Streaming is the leading premium streaming service offering live and on-demand TV and movies, with and without commercials, both in and outside the home. Operating at the intersection of entertainment and technology, Disney Streaming has a unique opportunity to be the number one choice for TV. We captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love, and we’re looking for people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking, and embracing fun. Join us and see what this is all about.
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join the Retention, Churn & Commerce (RCC) Analytics team to support a growing ecosystem of Disney’s streaming service offerings (Disney+, Star+, ESPN+, Hulu). The RCC Analytics team supports the business in understanding the dynamic and increasingly complex subscriber lifecycle, to maximize acquisition and minimize churn. The function masters experimentation, data modeling, exploratory data analysis, and advanced dashboard building to assess and recommend business decisions. This team collaborates cross-functionally across the Disney Streaming Services organization, as well as with groups and stakeholders from business units across The Walt Disney Company to generate insightful, compelling and strategic analysis and plans. The team’s work will drive the development of strategic and operational plans that are expected to have broad influence at all levels of the organization.
What You'll Do
Develop and maintain core business logic for measuring churn and the health of the DSS billing/payments/fraud product across Disney+, Star+, and ESPN+
Partner closely with business stakeholders (Product, Business Operations, Engineering, Finance, etc.) to identify and unlock opportunities for growth
Create and maintain operational dashboards in Tableau and Looker to understand performance over time, enable efficient exploratory analysis, and equip partners with self-serve tools
Translate complex business questions into SQL or LookML technical specifications, including proper cohorting, calculations, filtering criteria and/or aggregations
Understand the systems and business processes that populate critical systems with data
Collaborate with Data Architecture to design scalable and efficient solutions
What To Bring
5 years of strategic analysis to inform product or business decision making
5+ years of hands-on analytical work experience with SQL (ETL ownership, complex transformations, development of “analytical” datasets)
A/B testing and statistical fundamentals and experience
Strong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendations
Expertise manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Strong analytical and technical skills to troubleshoot issues, analyze the cause, quickly come-up with possible solutions, document the changes, and communicate organizational impact
Familiarity with data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau or Looker
Ability to think strategically, analyze and interpret market and consumer information
Strong experience in documenting the data requirements, data strategy, data rules (standardization, cleansing, and validation)
Nice-To-Haves
Experience in the streaming media industry or other subscription-based service
Experience in the technology industry, knowledge of data products
Python experience writing, managing and deploying code
Familiarity with data platforms and applications such as Databricks, Jupyter, Snowflake, Redshift, Airflow
Experience operating in an SDLC environment and deploying code
Basic Education
BA or BS in a quantitative field (Business, Math/Statistics, Economics, CS, Engineering, or similar)
Additional Information
DISNEYTECH
Just like the best ensemble casts of our favorite shows, Disney Streaming embraces diversity and is an inclusive environment. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Data Transformation Analyst II/Customer Support Associate
Job Description:
Job Description:
Your role
Are you an analytical thinker with a high level of attention to detail? Do you enjoy problem solving, data research, and helping customers with complex business solutions?
We’re looking for a Data Transformation Analyst/Customer Support Associate within the OPIS Retail Fuels Division. In this hybrid role, you will:
Maintain the data quality for retail fuels pricing, station, and amenities data across North America and Australia, eventually expanding globally.
Run quality control processes to correct or eliminate incorrect or invalid data points according to OPIS methodology.
Assist the retail business development and product development teams in data reliability goals.
Provide sales support by creating historical data files, setting prospective clients up on trials of our services, and answering questions regarding data methodology and data quality.
Continue the OPIS legacy of providing the highest-quality customer support in the industry.
Your team
We’re OPIS, a Dow Jones company. In this role, you will be joining the OPIS Retail Data Quality Team primarily located in the United States, with remote workers globally. This team of 10 direct colleagues and many secondary colleagues is part of a high-growth division that manages the quality of retail fuel pricing and station data. OPIS Retail team members work with fuel retailers and convenience store operators to provide data and analytics that help them optimize their business operations and run more profitably and efficiently.
You’ll also work with other industries that utilize OPIS data, such as connected cars and mobile app/web clients who display OPIS real-time retail fuel prices and station information directly to consumers. And in a world where the reliance on fossil fuels is slowly diminishing as we look for cleaner and more sustainable energy options, OPIS is diversifying and future-proofing our business by expanding into clean energy, alternative fuels, and data and analytics for electric vehicles, while still providing world class data and products for the energy that moves us today.
Your expertise
You have
A bachelor’s degree. Business, Data Analytics, and Mathematics degrees are a strong fit for this role.
Prior experience with data management and/or customer service.
Fluency in English, both written and oral, with other language skills desirable based on our global customer base.
Knowledge in data visualization/analytics tools such as Power BI or Tableu and a fluency in all MS Office applications, with advanced Excel expertise a priority. Proficiency in SQL Server Management Studio, R, or Python is a plus, but not required.
You are
Organized with strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
A self-motivated individual who is able to work effectively and collaboratively with all co-workers, while also completing projects independently.
Strong with data analytics, able to transform and analyze data to find insights and to create solutions that help automate improvements in our data quality.
Driven by the desire to help others succeed, delivering the highest levels of customer service and professionalism.
Working Hours
9:30am – 6:30pm Eastern Time (UTC -5)
Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy

Posted: Aug 4, 2022

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices strengthening our dedication to leave the world better than we found it. Do you want to join us in these pursuits? Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple products! The Tools and Process team creates solutions to address operational needs for Apple’s Hardware Technologies group. Leveraging Apple's internal software and services, we develop custom tools to address gaps and novel business needs. We design and standardize processes along with automating manual steps. We collect, analyze, and leverage data to provide critical insights for Hardware Tech. Our tools and processes impact numerous product lines and are transforming the way people work at Apple. We are looking for an outstanding analyst who can understand business needs, track and develop analytics, and implement technical solutions. This includes review of existing reports and making recommendations to improve quality and process efficiency. They will be expected to communicate relevant insights to senior leadership and key decision-makers. The ideal candidate works well in a collaborative setting with minimal formal structure and is comfortable in changing environments with competing priorities. They must possess solid business acumen, a strong technical background, natural curiosity, and the ability to effectively shift between communications styles based on the audience (technical peer review through leadership presentation).

Expert in Microsoft Excel, equipped with advanced skills, ex. PivotTables, Vlookup, index / match, and data tables.
Advanced skill in managing large datasets, and process automation
Competent in Python and data visualization

Familiar with statistical analysis and predictive modeling
Ability to tell meaningful and accurate stories with data analysis and visualization
Focus on data integrity
Drive to continuously improve and expand value of their own work and impact of the team
Ability to synthesize multiple sources of competing feedback to deliver the best solution
Description
- Capture business requirements, identify problems and opportunities to make an impact - Interpolate, process, and analyze data from multiple sources - Generate both regular and ad-hoc reports. Create standards for common reports, and create self-service reporting dashboards - Present data analysis and insights to business partners and executives - Identify and implement improvements to data structure and collection - Design and standardize processes - Identify manual business processes and work with developers to automate them - Develop relationships with cross-functional business partners to stay informed on their processes and needs - Respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting reports and documentation - Explore opportunities to leverage data and capabilities for new insights - Role is based in either Santa Clara Valley, or in San Diego with periodic travel to Santa Clara Valley

Deep background in data science or statistics required. Masters degree preferred in Data Science, Statistics, or MBA with data analysis focus

We build intrinsic value by partnering with all functions of our business to support their success and make strategic business decisions. We focus on professional development and continuous improvement while enjoying a casual work environment and Great Place to Work culture!
As a Business Analyst, you will maintain an understanding of the system in order to act as a liaison between IT, PMO, Product and the Business, you will understand your system; identify deficiencies and offer suggestions to improve it. You will gather requirements of medium complexity, partner with developers and test analyst, and test features to ensure they meet user requirements.
Outcomes and Activities:
This position will work from home; occasional planned travel to an office location may be required. However, this position is permitted to work at an office location if requested by the team member.
Gather requirements from business users and record them clearly in a format useful to developers and test analyst.
Work collaboratively with PMO, Product, Stakeholders and IT team member to achieve objectives.
Maintain application backlog that clearly describes tasks. Keep the backlog clean.
Partner with developers to achieve great application performance.
Test new features and code to be sure they meet business requirements.
Show insight; know your application design & data; offer simple, working solutions.
Analyses the risk and impact to the business.
Recognizes risks early and escalates in a timely manner.
Apply team coding, documenting and testing standards and recommend process improvement.
Recognize upstream and downstream impacts; communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Understand the business process your application supports.
Improve your application and team processes.
Decrease incidents and increase up-time of your application.

Competencies: The following items detail how you will be successful in this role.
Elicitation Techniques: Engage PMO, Product and stakeholders from multiple departments to build a shared understanding of the opportunity.
Facilitation Techniques: Organize, support and/or conduct workshops, meetings, presentations specific to the objectives of each, problem to be solve, and needs of the audience.
Impact Analysis: Understand the rationale behind and how changes impact the enterprise and/or applications and across the technical ecosystem.
Requirements Management: Plan, execute, monitor, and control any or all of the work associated with requirements elicitation and collaboration, requirements analysis and design, and requirements life cycle management.
Solution Design: Ability to translate high level requirements to create and implement designs that meet the needs of the customer, are technically sound, maintainable and cost effective. Ability to identify missing or ambiguous requirements. Ability to design at both high and low levels of abstraction, understand complex requirements and translate into understandable solutions. Ability to accurately estimate based on requirements.
Technical Domain: Have an understanding of the technical domain, including the application architecture, design and data of the application they support and systems to which it interfaces.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 2-year experience in Business Analyst or related role
Excellent oral and written communications skills
Experience documenting user requirements
QA Testing experience
Willingness to participate in an on-call rotation

Preferred Experience:
Experience with System Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Project management experience, PMP Certification
Minimum of 1-year experience supporting a web application as a business/quality/functional analyst
Basic knowledge of web technology
Ability to query a database (SQL / PLSQL)
Basic understanding of Java technologies
Testing certifications
Knowledge of testing tools such as JIRA / Service Now
Respond promptly and effectively to problems, projects, and tasks
Be organized, with ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple requests
Convey complex information in a timely and easily understood way to all levels of the organization
Demonstrate insight; make recommendations as opportunities arise
Be self-driven, motivated to help, and able to perform with moderate supervision
Maintain customer focus; keep the customer’s and company’s best interest in mind
Work well with abstract concepts. Be analytical. Solve problems

Job Description:
Sagitec is seeking Business Analysts to work with systems development teams, architects, and client stakeholders in our pension vertical. The role involves performing business and system analysis for clients looking to modernize or upgrade existing business processes and systems. You will be responsible for the design, testing, and implementation of the system to create a solution that satisfies our clients’ unique business needs.
No. of Positions: 2
Responsibilities:
Participate and collaborate with client, development, and testing teams throughout the design, development, testing, and implementation of a solution.
Lead meetings with client subject matter experts (SMEs) to elicit, clarify, and confirm business requirements.
Facilitate/support design meetings with Sagitec and client team participants.
Perform functional analysis of the client’s current business process and supporting documentation.
Identify process improvements and facilitate reengineering of business process.
Responsible for development of business analysis deliverables.
Support, and at times lead, the preparation of test cases and associated deliverables.
Execute production rollout activities.
Qualifications:
3 - 6 years of professional experience working in a Business Analyst role for the design, development, and implementation of large-scale solutions.
Experience evaluating business requirements and working with subject matter experts (SME) and technical analysts (TA) to translate into a functional design.
Experience of working in Agile and SCRUM for at least two years.
Proven ability to develop task plans, manage time effectively across simultaneous project activities, and meet target deadlines.
Drives assigned tasks to completion within target deadlines.
Approaches tasks in an analytical manner and focuses on defining a solution to the root need of the task.
Candidates with two or more years of pension, retirement, or unemployment systems domain experience will be preferred.
Education:
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science, IT, Management, Business, or related field.
Master’s degree a plus.

JOB SUMMARY
Responsible for technical assistance to the Pension unit. Responsible for ensuring technical workflows, coding updating, entering plan changes in system and general system assessment support.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Reviews benefit levels, agreement structures, vesting rules, and other system configurations are correct to guarantee pension payments benefits are calculated and paid in accordance with plan rules.
Ensures all factor tables are current and coordinates with the plan professionals to ensure upcoming changes are received and uploaded timely.
Develops plan changes implementations and plan comparisons to assure accuracy of system configurations.
Review of system workflows with testing of workflow to ensure desired system results, with recommendation of workflow implementation with significant organizational financial impact. Manages workflows and maintain workflow history of Vitech system.
Conducts system specification review, testing and provide recommendation for approval to implement system configuration changes into the production system.
Tests service packs prior to moving to production and confirms accuracy of move to production.
Responsible for the establishment of the quality production quality assurance plan development and implementation and the coordination of the internal audit of business practice to implement preventative procedures and controls. Design the audits, complete the audit, analyze the results and provide a recommendation of quality improvement for evaluation and implementation by the department’s Senior Manager and responsible Director.
Provides the research and analysis of proposed benefit changes to confirm the benefit change can be applied within the current system configuration or if additional programming is required and confirm findings with vendor.
Updates/maintains all external tools used in the calculation of benefits (e.g. Excel and VBA).
Provides quarterly LLC Pension status Reports and all other reports as needed.
Coordinates testing of system changes, test plan development, evaluation of testing results with determination if system change is ready to migrate to the production system. Tracking of system enhancement requests.
Notifies affected departments of system enhancements and impact.
Development of and tracking of system issues and resolution, and prioritization of the system issue with level of risk to Pension application processing or possible payment error.
Development of communication document to explain the system changes to all Pension staff.
Development of production quality assurance plan and implementation.
Coordinates internal audit of business practice, implement preventative procedures, and controls.
Coordinates and participates in the testing of upgrades and enhancements of the current software. Participates in creating testing scenarios to ensure upgraded programming matches Summary Plan Description language.
Coordinates system issues and resolution with vendors and the Pension department.
Coordinates and communicates with vendors to troubleshoot and resolve issues that prevent the finalization of Pension application processing.
Reviews system workflows as part of the workflow approval process.
Works with Retiree Health & Welfare unit to ensure accuracy of Pension benefit credits used to determine retiree health and welfare eligibility.
Performs periodic audits and updates of all databases containing member documents and images.
Coordinates and communicates with external auditors to provide documents and support for the annual audits.
Annual updates to disaster recovery and continuity plans for the pension unit.
Assist the pension management team to analyze and identify trends related to key performance indicators such as average handle time, hold times and survey satisfaction results.
Other duties as assigned.
MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university and 2 years of related experience.
A combination of appropriate education and experience may be substituted for the minimum education and experience requirements.
Strong knowledge of system workflows.
Strong knowledge of Excel and VBA (Visual Basic Analysis).
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIREMENTS
Interpersonal skills necessary to develop and maintain effective and appropriate working relationships with co-workers, vendors, and union representatives.
Skill in providing high quality customer service, including assessing and resolving customer questions and needs while adhering to customer service guidelines and procedures.
Ability to interpret and apply Summary Plan Description and plan rules, collective bargaining provisions, and the Board of Trustees directives.
Ability to comprehend vendor specifications.
Ability to explain complex policies and processes in layman’s terms.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and tact.
Ability to plan, develop and coordinate multiple projects.
Ability to present ideas effectively, orally and in writing.
Ability to prioritize departmental resources according to business objectives and deadlines.
Ability to be self-motivated.
Proficiency in the use of (or ability to learn) personal computer software or systems applicable to the essential functions of the job, which may include any or all of the following: email/calendar software, internet/intranet browsers, word processing, spreadsheets, database software, and various systems or software used by office.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Work is performed in a standard office environment with possible minor inconveniences due to occasional noise, crowded working conditions, and/or minor heating, cooling, or ventilation problems. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to:
Sit (regularly)
Stand or walk (occasionally)
Talk or hear (regularly)
Use hands to finger, handle or feel (regularly)
Reach with hands and arms (regularly)
Vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus. The employee is regularly required to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and may occasionally be required to lift and/or move up to 30 pounds (such as a box of paper).

Data & Telecommunications Analyst Job Summary
Are you looking to take your analyst job to the next level? We have an awesome opportunity with years of career growth ahead of you. As part of the Data & Telecommunications analyst team, responsible for overseeing technical expertise to ensure that voice communications are sufficient, appropriate, functioning and performing at optimum and cost-effective levels. Determines causes of systems malfunctions and directs or performs corrective actions. May solve highly technical complex problems and be called on to consult for other projects. Viewed as a Subject Matter Expert within the organization. Acts as a technical specialist within own area. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.

Data & Telecommunications Analyst Core Responsibilities
Participates in the design and maintenance of telecommunications networks; resolves complex network operating problems.
Diagnoses and resolves complex network operating problems with technical assistance from vendors, common carriers and technical IT management.
Analyzes performance of telecommunications network including usage, load patterns and systems responses.
Participates in topology design for new or modified systems, including the analysis of parameters such as timing responses, recovery capabilities, automatic diagnostics and redundancy capacity.
Directs and performs installations of telecommunications/network and test equipment.
Work with senior business management to create business cases, cost basis analysis and ROI models for major telecom capital expenditures.
Develops work instructions, procedures and policies in support of company requirements.
Directs project teams in completing projects.
Monitors system performance, troubleshoot outages and manages vendors to ensure optimal system performance.
Leads Vendor Management: meets with vendors to understand new technologies, works with vendor to resolve complex or high priority issues and works with vendor to obtain quotes for purchasing / procurement process.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and experience -7-10 years of relative experience
Demonstrated background in Media Marketing channel performance analytics and KPIs
Comparable analytic experience within a marketing environment, preferably in direct response
Demonstrated leadership in the area of campaign performance tracking (Direct Mail, Email, Digital and Media channels)
Demonstrated ability distilling disparate data sets into a cohesive narrative and communicating effectively to various audiences
Adept at delivering infographics or distilling complex data into graphical presentations
Collaborate with the immediate and broader functional team to help provide holistic actionable insights. Delivering through cross-functional partnerships.
Expertise with several leading data and analytics tools, such as Excel, Tableau, SQL Server, Adobe Campaign, Adobe Analytics.
Proficient in SQL to query large data platforms
Ability to execute marketing campaign lists through Adobe Campaign (CRM tool)
Ability to create and execute actionable test designs
Strong Analytic and critical thinking skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills

401k available after 90 days

Introduction to the job
ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon. The holder of this position will be based in San Diego (California, USA) reporting directly to the Sr. Director of Business Administration.

About Us:
LinkIt! is a market leader providing data warehousing, analytics, assessment, and MTSS solutions for K-12 schools. We help schools streamline the process of collecting, managing, and analyzing student performance data to improve academic achievement, save time, and increase overall productivity. Specifically, the company’s data warehouse and assessment platform enable schools to store and analyze both third-party and locally created data for all grade levels and subject areas. LinkIt! also provides custom analytical services to help schools better understand their data for more effective decision-making and action planning. Lastly, our MTSS solution helps schools optimize workflows to create individualized learning plans for students.
At LinkIt, we come to work every day knowing that our work has a direct impact on students, teachers, and their ability to succeed. While we differentiate our products by being comprehensive, easy-to-use, and innovative, our unique value proposition is our relentless focus on customer service and support.
For more about us, please visit linkit.com.

Identify potential issues with analyses and provide quick and thorough problem-solving responses

Reformat and process raw data files sent by clients for data warehousing purposes in a time-effective manner
Looking to expand our statistical analytical tools, such as predictive analytics and machine learning

Meticulous and detail-oriented
Strong communication skills
Pride and sense of ownership in one’s work
Confident, humble, and positive attitude

Experience with SQL, Python, OLAP, and data visualization tools a plus
Basic or advanced understanding of statistics a plus
Ability to quickly troubleshoot problems/inconsistencies with models and formulas
Strong understanding of statistical concepts
Strong analytical skills: a natural problem solver who is clinical in diagnosing a problem and creative in finding a solution

Responsible for using experience and a hands-on approach to engage with Data Scientists and Data Engineers, resulting in the generation and consumption of data for various business initiatives on next-generation data platforms.
Responsibilities
Be the bridge between Data Scientist and Data Engineering to enable data application development. Understands at a fundamental level, our data ingestion and processing frameworks. Gathers data application requirements from Data Scientists and other operational teams to ensure that the business needs will be met. Designs transformation logic in source to targets to be implemented by partner Data Engineers. Partners with the Data Scientists and Data Engineers throughout the development and testing processes by ensuring that the team understands the parameters and needs of the project. Schedules and runs data application/model deployments and validations between Data Engineering and Data Scientists.
Utilizes deep knowledge of in-house data to assist Data Scientists in developing models, analytic processes, and reports to drive business value. Provides guidance to Data Scientists in creating efficient and fast-performing data consumption processes to meet service objectives. Highly efficient in understanding logic implemented in languages such as Python, R, and other analytics tools used by Data Scientists.
Provides support for deployed data applications and analytical models by being a trusted advisor to Data Scientists and other data consumers by identifying data problems and guiding issue-resolution with partner Data Engineers.
Ensures that proper data governance policies are followed by implementing or validating Data Lineage, Quality checks, classification, etc.
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:
Bachelor's Degree in formation Technology, or related field
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business analysis, data application programming, ETL development, or related field
In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in data analysis, business analysis, data application programming, ETL development, or related field
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, we’d also look for:
1+ years of experience with Cloud
Master’s degree in data analytics, or related field
Intermediate to deep knowledge of SQL
Experience working with various stakeholders
Exposure to business intelligence and reporting
Experience working on large scale / complex projects
Understanding of databases and data models

Job Title: (Remote) Analyst, Capital Markets - San Antonio Texas
Job Description:
Overview

Are you looking to take your career from good to great? As an employee of PenFed, every day is an opportunity to thrive, and be part of a team working to ensure our organization is providing world class service to our members, employees, and our communities. We exist to help our members realize their full potential, educate and encourage their dreams, and make every effort to follow our mission and help our members "do better." Joining PenFed is more than being an employee; it's about being a part of the PenFed family.

PenFed is hiring a (Remote) Analyst, Capital Markets at one of the following locations: Tysons, Virginia; San Antonio, Texas; Eugene, Oregon; or Omaha, Nebraska. The primary purpose of this job is to support the treasury and capital markets functions within PenFed, and any other tasks assigned to this role. The incumbent is expected to gain exposure and overview of all the capital markets activities in a short amount of time and is expected to contribute to the activities of the team.

Responsibilities

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job duties and the position will perform other duties as assigned.


Analyze data to support capital markets decisions using advanced data analytics tools such as Excel, VBA, SAS, R, Python, Tableau etc.
Work with experienced team members in Capital Markets team to automate loan sale due diligence process and reporting requirements.
Analyze and tie out collateral stratifications and replines for consumer securitization transactions using tools such as CAS, SQL or Excel.
Create monthly investor reporting package for securitization transactions with coordination from credit, accounting, investor reporting teams and respond to any investor queries or questions related to the securitization transactions.
Extract and collect data from multiple systems and data repositories for regular reporting and adhoc reporting.
Perform portfolio analysis of loans purchased from third parties and publish loan production and performance reports.
Publish detailed sector research reports for active and new asset classes for the Portfolio and be able to compile/present relevant market research to the senior team members to help them make portfolio management decisions.
Provide administrative support for loan sales and loan purchases.
Publish various reports needed for operational, consumer, and real estate loan reviews on a monthly basis.
Prepare and publish the monthly department production and performance dashboard.
Prepare formal written analysis for senior management.
Participates in related special projects as assigned by senior management.

Qualifications

Equivalent combination of education and experience is considered.


Bachelor's degree in a related field required.
Minimum of two (2) years' experience in analyzing macro-economic data, risk management, capital markets and portfolio management areas.
Proficiency with statistical/data analysis required.
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools such as CAS, Excel VBA, SQL, Python, R, Tableau etc.
Strong working knowledge of accounting principles.
Strong working knowledge of MS Office applications.
Supervisory Responsibility
This position will not supervise employees.
Licenses and Certifications
There are no additional certifications required.
Work Environment
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to an indoor office setting with moderate noise.

*Most roles require working in an office setting with moderate noise and the ability to lift 25 pounds.*

Travel
Ability to travel to various worksites and be on-call may be required.

Special Message Regarding COVID 19

PenFed is continuing to hire and train exceptional individuals to help us serve our 2 million members both here and around the world. In light of the current situation with COVID-19, we have modified our hiring, onboarding, training, and deployment protocols in order to comply with applicable current local and state guidance.

About Us

Established in 1935, PenFed today is one of the country's strongest and most stable financial institutions with over 2 million members and over $26 billion in assets. We serve members in all 50 states and the District of Columbia, as well as in Guam, Puerto Rico and Okinawa. We are federally insured by NCUA and we are an Equal Housing Lender. We are available to members worldwide, via the web, seven days a week, twenty-four hours a day.

We provide our employees with a lucrative benefits package including robust medical, dental and vision plan options, plenty of paid time off, 401k with employer match, on-site fitness facilities at our larger locations, and more.

Equal Employment Opportunity

PenFed management will maintain and observe personnel policies which will not discriminate or permit harassment or retaliation against a person because of race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, military or veteran status or obligation, the presence of a physical and/or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, and all statuses protected by applicable state or local law in all recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, overtime, position classifications, work assignments, facilities, promotions, transfers, employee treatment, and in all other terms and conditions of employment. PenFed will also prohibit retaliation against individuals for raising a complaint of discrimination or harassment or participating in an investigation of same.

PenFed will also reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability so that they can apply for a job or perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace and the threat cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation or if the accommodation creates an undue hardship to PenFed. Contact human resources (HR) with any questions or requests for accommodation at 240-224-4256.

SUMMARY: As a leader in the banking industry, BankUnited is a fast paced, dynamic company driven by a keen entrepreneurial spirit. We are looking for talented individuals who are eager to be a part of building something new and cutting edge. If you thrive in a constantly changing environment, are excited by the opportunity to think outside the box and challenge the status quo and excel at multi-tasking and working under pressure, then this might be the perfect role for you! The Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst is part of a team tasked with the rationalization and improvement of dashboards, recurring reports, and ad-hoc reporting and business intelligence tools. This includes redesign and rationalization, where applicable, of current reporting framework, in an effort to reduce duplication, automation wherever possible and the inclusion of meaningful KPIs and external data where applicable. The team operates in a fast paced environment and must be able to juggle competing demands and, often, tight deadlines. The team works closely with key stakeholders across the organization to identify opportunities, as well as with IT partners to ensure our data infrastructure continues to support the business needs. The team works in an Agile framework. All team members are expected to have strong communication excel, data and analytical skills.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties and special projects may be assigned.
Works closely with FPA partners on package / dashboard design and to validate business requirements and data integrity.
Conducts analysis and builds meaningful reports and visualizations or dashboards from raw data for consumption by multiple stakeholders.
Works closely with IT partners to ensure the data framework continues to meet the requirements.
Extracts data from source systems and, where applicable, builds automation routines.
Applies data analytics and modelling to identify financial opportunities for business lines.
Assists team leader and department leadership in identifying opportunities and requirements.
Works on continuing implementation of relevant software and system updates
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics or STEM field required, though advanced degrees or specialization in a STEM field are preferred
Strong interpersonal skills to manage relationships across different divisions within the entire company
Strong communication skills (both verbal and written) with the ability to articulate complex concepts into a format digestible by a diverse audience
Ability to understand the business context and value derived from reports and dashboards
Prior experience working in an Agile framework preferred
Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, manage competing initiatives and adapt to an ever changing work pace with a focus on accuracy and attention to detail
Advanced knowledge of Excel preferred, working knowledge required
Ability to design and develop reports and dashboards using SQL-based tools
Demonstrated proficiency with Power BI, Tableau or other BI/Data Visualization tools
Some proficiency in programming languages, particularly R, Python and SQL
Prior relevant work experience preferred, but recent graduates will also be considered
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:
MBA, CFA, FRM or progress towards any of these designations is preferred.

Marketing Data Insights Analyst
**Canandaigua National Bank & Trust
Location: Canandaigua, NY (Hybrid Flexibility, must be able to be onsite 3 days/wk. and as needed).*
What does a Marketing Data Insights Analyst at CNB do?*
As a Marketing Data Insights Analyst at CNB, you would play a critical role in Marketing’s support of the entire organization. You would be responsible for such activities as: writing and running SQL queries to generate various outreach audiences (mail, email, Salesforce task/referral lists, etc.), summarizing performance of marketing initiatives and providing recommendations for future enhancements, developing automated marketing programs/journeys, guiding organizational decision-making by producing thoughtful analyses based on value extracted from CNC’s data assets and other 3rd party data, and more!
Successful Marketing Data Insights Analysts are motivated, independent, analytical thinkers who show great attention to detail. They must also work well in a team environment, be able to see the larger vision and motivation for our work, and understand the challenges facing CNC’s various lines of business.
This position works closely with fellow Marketing teammates and also with representatives from all levels and lines of business.
What competencies are needed to be successful in this role?
A B.S. or B.A. degree with an emphasis in business, statistics, data analytics, or other mathematics-related fields normally required, or equivalent banking/financial services experience
Must be proficient in SQL and Excel
Experience with relational databases and database querying
Experience with Salesforce or other enterprise CRM system(s). Familiarity with Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Experience with Power Pivot, Power BI, or other data analysis/business intelligence tools
4+ years of business and marketing data analysis experience
3+ years of experience in advanced analytics methodologies, data visualization, dashboard creation, experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, survey/market research
Familiarity with predictive analytics and modeling
Strong interpersonal and project management skills, with demonstrated ability to work well both individually and in a collaborative team environment, meeting time demands
What does a successful first year in this position look like?
Independently perform research and analysis with regard to households, customers, accounts, products, pricing, prospects, markets, industry and competition using a variety of research vehicles. Present analyses, delivering insight and making recommendations based on findings.
Participate in the development of marketing programs/journeys for the bank's products and services as well as manage post-outreach analytics and general promotion of a perpetual “testing & learning” mindset.
Create queries and reports as needed for Marketing and the lines of business Marketing supports using Salesforce/Marketing Cloud, the CNC Data Warehouse (SQL Server & Power BI), Bank Intelligence, etc.
Manage issue resolution, enhancement requests, quality control testing, and value optimization for Marketing’s data and data-related systems (Salesforce/Marketing Cloud, the CNC Data Warehouse, Power BI, etc.)
Assist in the development and socialization of various Segmentation strategies, including creation of profiles of segments by relationship, product usage, etc.
Work collaboratively with the team to establish customer treatments/journeys for Marketing and perform general duties related to list production, lead distribution, management, and reporting for those Marketing supports.
What makes working at CNB different?
At CNB, we are Investing in You. Our strong corporate culture is based upon seven Core Values: Honesty and Integrity, Responsibility, Teamwork, Respect, Innovation, Professionalism, and Commitment. Our culture nurtures passionate employees and offers great rewards including:
Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, HSA options for both part-time and full-time employees. Medical coverage is also offered for domestic partners.
Paid Holidays, Vacation, and Sick time.
Retirement benefits that include a 401(k), Profit Sharing, and Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP).
Training & Development Opportunities.
Tuition Assistance.
Volunteer Opportunities.
Award Winning Wellness program that promotes a solid work/life balance.
Banking perks and discount programs.
Our goal is to ensure that our bank, employees, and our community thrive and grow, now and for the next 135 years. We're in it for the long haul. What truly sets us apart from other financial institutions is the quality and commitment of our employees. We've assembled a diverse team of people who share a primary focus: to provide exceptional service for our customers.
As an organization, we are committed to hiring, training, developing, promoting, and celebrating employees from historically disadvantaged groups. At CNB, we welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of ethnicity, race, sex, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, veteran’s status, religion, disability, sexual orientation, education, and culture.
As the only local, full-service, community-owned financial institution in the Rochester area, Canandaigua National Bank & Trust is Investing in You. If you want to be a part of something special, join us today!
Canandaigua National Corporation and its subsidiaries encourage diversity in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.
